summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell. The document is a formal cover letter for legal discovery in her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The recipient of discovery materials, identified as an inmate at the Metropolitan Detention Center in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, transmitting discovery materials to the detention center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority transmitting discovery to the defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal cover letter dated August 21, 2020, from the U.S. Attorney's Office to the Metropolitan Detention Center.
It pertains to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Its purpose is to transmit discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (Inmate #02879-509).
Audrey Strauss is identified as the Acting United States Attorney at the time.
It confirms Maxwell was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn as of August 2020.
